definition.description: This class exposes static methods for updating the user's Discord activity from the game client.
definition.name: Discord

methods.declaration: void SetActivity(table params, string params, string params, string params, string params, string params, string params)
methods.description:
Updates the Discord Rich Presence activity. 

All parameters are optional and should be passed via a table. Missing fields default to empty values.
methods.name: SetActivity

params.description: .state Text shown as the activity state.
params.name: params

params.description: .largeImageKey Key of the large image asset.
params.name: params

params.description: .largeImageText Tooltip text for the large image.
params.name: params

params.description: .smallImageKey Key of the small image asset.
params.name: params

params.description: .smallImageText Tooltip text for the small image.
params.name: params

constructors.description: Creates a new Draw object with default settings.

constructors.declaration: int x, int y, string text
constructors.description: Creates a new Draw object with an initial position and text.

definition.description:
2D text drawing helper for rendering overlay text on screen.

The Draw class stores position, text, font, color, alpha and visibility.
Call render() each frame to draw the text using current settings.
definition.name: Draw

methods.description: Sets the draw position in virtual screen units.
methods.name: setPosition

methods.description: Returns the draw position in virtual screen units.
methods.name: getPosition

returns.description: Table containing x and y (virtual units).

methods.name: setPositionPx

methods.description: Returns the draw position in pixel coordinates.
methods.name: getPositionPx

returns.description: Table containing x and y in pixels.

methods.description: Returns the current text.
methods.name: getText

methods.name: setFont

methods.name: getFont

methods.description: Returns the current text color.

params.name: visible

constructors.description: Creates a new Sound from a file.

definition.description:
Sound playback helper.

Provides basic control over a sound resource loaded from a file, including
playback, looping, volume, stereo balance and querying playback state.
definition.name: Sound

methods.description: Starts sound playback.
methods.name: play

methods.description: Stops sound playback.
methods.name: stop

methods.description: Returns whether the sound is currently playing.
methods.name: isPlaying

returns.description: True if the sound is playing.

properties.description: Gets or sets the sound file path.
properties.name: file

properties.description: Returns the current playback time.
properties.name: playingTime

properties.description: Gets or sets the playback volume.
properties.name: volume

properties.description: Gets or sets whether the sound should loop.
properties.name: looping

properties.description: Gets or sets the stereo balance (pan).
properties.name: balance

constructors.declaration: int x, int y, int width, int height, string file

definition.description:
2D texture rendering helper for drawing image quads on screen.

Stores position, size, rect, color, alpha, visibility and source file.
Call render() to draw the texture using current settings.

constructors.description: Creates a quaternion with default values.
Creates a quaternion with W component set to the given value.

constructors.declaration: number x, number y, number z, number w
constructors.description: Creates a quaternion with explicit x, y, z and w components.

definition.description:
Quaternion representing 3D rotation.

Provides conversion to/from matrices, Euler angles and axis-angle, as well as
common quaternion operations and interpolation utilities.
definition.name: Quat

methods.description: Converts this quaternion to a 3x3 rotation matrix.
methods.name: toMat3

methods.description: Sets this quaternion from a 3x3 rotation matrix.
methods.name: fromMat3

methods.description: Converts this quaternion to a 4x4 rotation matrix.
methods.name: toMat4

methods.description: Sets this quaternion from a 4x4 transform matrix (rotation part).
methods.name: fromMat4

methods.description: Converts this quaternion to Euler angles.
methods.name: toEuler

methods.description: Sets this quaternion from Euler angles.
methods.name: fromEuler

methods.description:
Converts this quaternion to axis-angle representation.

The returned Vec4 contains (axis.x, axis.y, axis.z, angle).
methods.name: toAxisAngle

methods.description: Sets this quaternion from an axis and angle.
methods.name: fromAxisAngle

methods.description: Sets this quaternion to identity (no rotation).
methods.name: makeIdentity

methods.description: Returns true if this quaternion is identity (within epsilon tolerance).
methods.name: isIdentity

methods.description: Returns the quaternion length.
methods.name: len

methods.description: Returns the squared quaternion length.
methods.name: len2

methods.description: Returns an approximate quaternion length.
methods.name: lenApprox

methods.description:
Normalizes the quaternion in-place.

If the quaternion length is zero, no change is applied.
methods.name: normalize

methods.description:
Normalizes the quaternion in-place using an epsilon check.

If the quaternion length is below a small threshold, no change is applied.
methods.name: normalizeSafe

methods.description: Normalizes the quaternion in-place using an approximate inverse square root.
methods.name: normalizeApprox

methods.declaration: void set(number x, number y, number z, number w)
methods.description: Sets quaternion components.
methods.name: set

methods.description:
Returns the inverse quaternion.

For unit quaternions, this is equivalent to conjugate().
methods.name: inverse

methods.description: Returns the conjugate quaternion.
methods.name: conjugate

methods.description: Returns the dot product of two quaternions.
methods.name: dot

methods.declaration: Quat lerp(number t, Quat q1, Quat q2)
methods.description: Linearly interpolates between two quaternions.
methods.name: lerp

methods.declaration: Quat slerp(number t, Quat q1, Quat q2)
methods.description: Spherically interpolates between two quaternions.
methods.name: slerp

methods.declaration: Quat squad(number t, Quat q1, Quat q2, Quat q3)
methods.description: Performs a squad-style interpolation using three quaternions.
methods.name: squad

methods.description: Creates a quaternion that looks in the given forward direction with the given up direction.
methods.name: lookRotation

properties.name: x

properties.name: y

properties.description: Z component.
properties.name: z

events.description: Triggered once when the Gothic engine initializes.
events.name: onInit

events.description: Triggered when the Gothic engine is exiting.
events.name: onExit

events.description: Triggered each frame when the game renders.
events.name: onRender

events.description: Triggered when a key is pressed.
events.name: onKeyDown

events.description: Triggered when a key is released.
events.name: onKeyUp

events.description: Triggered when a player object is created locally.
events.name: onPlayerCreate

events.description: Triggered when a local player object is destroyed.
events.name: onPlayerDestroy

events.declaration: int sender_id, int r, int g, int b, string message
events.description: Triggered when a chat message is received locally.
events.name: onPlayerMessage

events.declaration: int day, int hour, int min
events.description: This event is triggered every time the server clock updates.
events.name: onGameTime

events.description: Triggered when a player connects to the server.
events.name: onPlayerConnect

params.description: The id of the player that connected.
params.name: player_id

events.description: Triggered when a player disconnects from the server.
events.name: onPlayerDisconnect

params.description: The id of the player that disconnected.
params.name: player_id

events.description: Triggered when a player sends a chat message.
events.name: onPlayerMessage

params.description: The id of the player who sent the message.
params.name: player_id

events.description: Triggered when a player issues a command.
events.name: onPlayerCommand

params.description: The id of the player issuing the command.
params.name: player_id

events.declaration: int from_id, int to_id, string text
events.description: Triggered when a player whispers to another player.
events.name: onPlayerWhisper

events.description: Triggered when a player kills another player.
events.name: onPlayerKill

events.description: Triggered when a player dies.
events.name: onPlayerDeath

params.description: The id of the player who died.
params.name: player_id

params.description: Optional id of the killer (nil if none).
params.name: killer_id

events.declaration: int player_id, int item_instance, int amount
events.description: Triggered when a player drops an item.

params.description: Player id who dropped the item.
params.name: player_id

events.description: Triggered when a player picks up an item.
events.name: onPlayerTakeItem

params.description: Player id who took the item.
params.name: player_id

events.declaration: int caster_id, int spell_id, int target_id
events.description: Triggered when a player casts a spell.

params.description: Optional target player id (nil if none).
params.name: target_id

events.declaration: int player_id, int x, int y, int z
events.description: Triggered when a player spawns (initial spawn).

events.declaration: int player_id, int x, int y, int z
events.description: Triggered when a player respawns.
events.name: onPlayerRespawn

events.declaration: int attacker_id, int victim_id, int damage

functions.description: The function is used to check whether the specified keyboard key is pressed.
functions.name: KeyPressed

params.description: The key code to check. For more information about key codes, see [Key Constants](../../client-constants/key.md).

returns.description: True if the key is currently pressed, false otherwise.

functions.description: The function is used to check whether the specified keyboard key was toggled from unpressed to pressed state.
functions.name: KeyToggled

params.description: The key code to check. For more information about key codes, see [Key Constants](../../client-constants/key.md).
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the key was toggled, false otherwise.

functions.description:
Logs a message with ERROR severity.

Error messages indicate serious problems that prevent normal operation
or cause a feature to fail.
functions.name: LOG_ERROR

params.description: The message text, may contain format specifiers.
params.name: text

functions.description:
Logs a message with INFO severity.

Informational messages describe normal application behavior and
important runtime events.
functions.name: LOG_INFO

params.description: The message text, may contain format specifiers.
params.name: text

functions.description:
Logs a message with DEBUG severity.

Debug messages provide diagnostic information useful during development
and troubleshooting.
functions.name: LOG_DEBUG

params.description: The message text, may contain format specifiers.
params.name: text

functions.description:
Logs a message with CRITICAL severity.

Critical messages report very severe errors that may require immediate
attention or application shutdown.
functions.name: LOG_CRITICAL

params.description: The message text, may contain format specifiers.
params.name: text

functions.description:
Logs a message with WARN severity.

Warning messages indicate potential problems or unusual situations that
do not immediately stop execution.
functions.name: LOG_WARN

params.description: The message text, may contain format specifiers.
params.name: text

functions.description:
Logs a message with TRACE severity.

Trace messages provide very detailed output, typically used for
low-level debugging and deep diagnostics.
functions.name: LOG_TRACE

params.description: The message text, may contain format specifiers.
params.name: text

functions.description: Convert hex color to rgb representation.
functions.name: hexToRgb

returns.description: Table containing r, g, b components.

functions.declaration: string rgbToHex(int r, int g, int b)
functions.description: Convert rgb color to hex representation.
functions.name: rgbToHex

params.description: Red color component in RGB model.
params.name: r

params.description: Green color component in RGB model.
params.name: g

params.description: Blue color component in RGB model.
params.name: b

returns.description: Lower case hexadecimal representation of rgb color.

functions.description: Split the specified text, interprets it according to format and stores the results into array.
functions.name: sscanf

params.description: Format by which the text will be splitted. Each letter in the format represents one argument in the text. If the number of letters in the format will be greater than the number of arguments in the text, then function will fail. Currently supported data formats: `d` integer, `f` float, `s` string.
params.name: format

params.description: Text which will be splitted into parts.
params.name: text

returns.description: The array which contains splitted text, or null if text couldn't be converted.

functions.description: This function will get the amount of time that your system has been running in milliseconds. You can use this function to compare how long something would take to run.
functions.name: getTickCount

returns.description: The amount of time that your system has been running in miliseconds.

functions.description: This function will calculate the SHA-256 hash of the specified string and return it as hexadecimal text representation.
functions.name: sha256

returns.description: Returns string hash as hexadecimal text representation.

functions.description: This function will calculate the SHA-512 hash of the specified string and return it as hexadecimal text representation.
functions.name: sha512

returns.description: Returns string hash as hexadecimal text representation.

functions.declaration: int setTimer(function func, int interval, int execute_times, ... ...)
functions.description:
Creates a new timer that calls the given function at a fixed interval.

The timer passes any additional arguments to the callback when it executes.
If execute_times is 0 or negative, the timer repeats indefinitely.
functions.name: setTimer

params.description: Callback function executed by the timer.
params.name: func

params.description: How many times to execute the callback (<= 0 means infinite).
params.name: execute_times

params.description: Additional arguments forwarded to the callback.

functions.description: Stops and removes an existing timer.
functions.name: killTimer

functions.description: Sets the interval (in milliseconds) of an existing timer.
functions.name: setTimerInterval

functions.description: Returns the interval (in milliseconds) of a timer, or nil if the timer does not exist.
functions.name: getTimerInterval

returns.description: Interval in milliseconds, or nil if not found.

functions.description:
Sets how many times the timer should execute.

If execute_times is 0 or negative, the timer repeats indefinitely.
functions.name: setTimerExecuteTimes

params.description: How many times to execute (<= 0 means infinite).
params.name: execute_times

functions.description:
Returns how many times the timer will execute, or nil if the timer does not exist.

A value of 0 means the timer repeats indefinitely.
functions.name: getTimerExecuteTimes

returns.description: Execute count (0 = infinite), or nil if not found.
